chapter.title: Management Server Installation
chapter.para:
The Cloud.com Management Server download includes everything you need to get started, except MySQL. This includes the Cloud.com software as well as dependencies. This section describes installing one or more Management Servers with one instance of MySQL, which may be on a different node from the Management Servers. The procedure for the installation is:
Prepare the operating system
Install and configure the management server
Install and configure MySQL

section.title: Operating System Preparation
section.para: The Cloud.com Management Server requires RHEL/CentOS 5.4 64 bit or later. The OS must be prepared to host the Management Server using the following steps.

note.para: NTP configuration is highly recommended. Installing and configuring ntp or chrony should be done on all hosts

listitem.para: Edit the /etc/hosts file to make sure that the Management Server has a fully-qualified host name that resolves to an IP address.

note.para: The above will make the management server, but in a production environment the host name should be configured via DNS

listitem.para: Log in as root. All the subsequent steps should be run as root.
Ensure that the SELINUX variable in /etc/selinux/config is set to permissive.
Run the following command to disable SELinux in the current session.

note.para: Performing both of the above steps is mandatory to avoid a reboot.

listitem.para: Make sure that the Management Server can reach the Internet.
